title: Does Enya actually sing in the language of the fallen angels? - Quora

response.answer_text: How can you or I, or anyone on this earth answer that question. Have you ever heard an angel sing? Fallen or other wise. I seriously doubt that any person alive, have heard Angel speak or angelic music. You do realize that their voices are not like ours. If we were to actually here Angel speak, it might be too much for our brains and ears and maybe even our hearts to take in. I mean with out having a complete meltdown of the body and mind. I think they would have A much different speech pattern than ours. But as I said we would only be guessing. I would like to here them sing, someday. Maybe when the Lord brings me home. I'll get that opportunity until then I'm content with my imagination. That is what he gave us one for. right?

No. I assume you are talking about some of her Welsh lyrics, which is a perfectly human, albeit quite beautiful, language, or possibly singing in Sindarin or Quenya for her Lord of the Rings songs, also quite beautiful but made up by JRR Tolkein. One would also feel compelled to ask, “What exactly is the language of fallen angels, anyways?”
For some fictional language from some storytelling perhaps. But how would we know? What book are you reading from that would propose that? That’s truly original.
